revised_title: Parasite-Host Interactions in South African Loranthoideae Species
tldr: The author examines the modes of union and interaction between parasites and hosts in three South African Loranthoideae species. They describe the haustorial structure and behavior of Loranthus elegans, Tapinanthus prunifolius, and Taxillus glaucus, revealing fundamental differences between them. The study provides insights into the complex relationships between these plants and their hosts, as well as the prevalence of 'runners' in the Loranthoideae subfamily.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
